flow.descriptionCdata:
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.0858602c-496c-425e-9eab-6798226bd462.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.0a72d4ca-0a99-4266-8565-d6a16eedbb84.prompt=Network Name / Port Group\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.14e17e79-113f-49dc-b6ba-f4d3a47c49a3.prompt=Asynchronously Perform Task?\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.21e302c6-f886-4d38-b404-bc98c02150a0.prompt=Network Name / Port Group\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.24992ef0-b045-4f6d-866c-21d6e079c2be.prompt=Enable Wake On LAN?\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.2c07a230-6202-47fb-ac96-c19f71a7c68b.prompt=VMWare User\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.36407f93-21b9-47da-b32f-29501425a0af.description=
Compares two strings, returning a true response if and only if they contain the same sequence of characters. A null string is considered to be equal to an empty string.

Inputs\:
string1 - The first string.
string2 - The second string.
ignoreCase - If set to 'true', then the comparison ignores case considerations. The two strings are considered equal ignoring case if they are of the same length and corresponding characters in the two strings are equal ignoring case. If set to any value other than 'true', then the strings must match exactly to be considered equal.

responses\:
true - If the two strings are equal
false - If the two strings are not equal
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.43c15245-707a-4b41-878b-0eec95decb04.prompt=Close session?\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.45723f17-98ac-4c11-adc7-8a0e307e8b66.prompt=Datacenter to look for VM\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.46abfb84-3c82-4e29-8047-925610329894.prompt=Datacenter to look for VM\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.48dd4cee-6114-437e-a3a1-e0a32c15c6f0.description=
Modifies an existing Network Interface Card (NIC) on a virtual machine. Optional inputs with a "net" and "connect" prefix that are left empty will not be modified on the NIC.

Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.
    user - VMware username.
    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMware Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    async - Asynchronously perform the task.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    taskTimeOut - Time to wait in seconds before the operation is considered to have failed.
Default value\: 800
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type 
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"
    vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
    deviceNumber - The NIC number to modify on the VM.  As an example\: "Network Adapter 1" would have be deviceNumber "1".
Examples\: If a VM as a network adapter named "Network Adapter 1" the deviceNumber would be "1".
    netPortGroup - Name of port group to connect this NIC to.  This port group can be a legacy port group or a distributed virtual port group.
Examples\: "VM Network", "dvPortGroup"
    netNicType - Virtual network interface card type. NIC type VmxNet2 is only supported for virtual machine hardware version 4 and later.  NIC type VmxNet3 is only supported for vitual machine hardware version 7 and later.
Valid values\: "PCNet32", "E1000", "VmxNet", "VmxNet2", "VmxNet3"
    netMacAddr - MAC address to assign if netMacGeneration is set to Manual.
Value format\: Six groups of two hexadecimal digits (0-F), separated by colons (\:).
Examples\: 00\:50\:56\:94\:AB\:EF
    netMacGeneration - MAC address assignment method. 
Valid inputs\: "Manual", "Generated", "Assigned" (Assigned value is only valid when host is a vCenter server. Will assign MAC from vCenter).
    netWakeOnLan - Enable Wake On LAN for the NIC.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connect - Connect the NIC to the network?  Only applicable when VM is powered on.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connectAtPowerOn - Connect the NIC to the network at power on time of VM?
Valid values\: "true", "false"

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong. See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task result or operation result

Notes\:
1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.53ec08b5-29b3-40de-9175-50fe2b461023.prompt=VMWare User\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.5532a0ed-3f39-404b-82b4-ba6f8a7b4da0.prompt=Network Name / Port Group\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.5da70614-7dc3-4b36-a15d-85e2a27b29cd.prompt=Password\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.6944ca98-b286-4344-9bc7-45997be2597e.prompt=VMWare User\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.7a1b1df7-622f-4fba-a77e-20c62b509720.prompt=Identify VM by\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.7be88744-8d3b-453b-a67c-88dfff74e5f6.description=
Check to see if the value stored in a specified flow variable, denoted by key, is null.

Inputs\:
keyName - The key to check, i.e. the name of the flow variable.

Returns\: 
The value in the specified key, i.e. flow variable.

Responses\:
isNull - If the key is a null pointer, i.e. the flow variable doesn't have an assigned value.
notNull - If some value is stored in the key, i.e the flow variable has a value assigned.
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.841ff630-0dc9-4203-91c9-bce1f7ec9217.prompt=VMWare Host\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.8ad6ea28-c33a-44a9-9516-d863afc83e8b.prompt=Datacenter to look for VM\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.8b0016cf-66d0-4e19-ad2c-e7cd2b76dba8.prompt=Password\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.8de3007e-41d7-4b66-a214-e4eb06d66385.description=
Modifies an existing Network Interface Card (NIC) on a virtual machine. Optional inputs with a "net" and "connect" prefix that are left empty will not be modified on the NIC.

Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.
    user - VMware username.
    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.
Examples\: 443, 80
    protocol - Connection protocol.
Valid values\: "https", "http"
    closeSession - Close the internally kept VMware Infrastructure API session at completion of operation.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    async - Asynchronously perform the task.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    taskTimeOut - Time to wait in seconds before the operation is considered to have failed.
Default value\: 800
    virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
    vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type 
Valid values\: "inventorypath", "name", "ip", "hostname", "uuid", "vmid"
    vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
    deviceNumber - The NIC number to modify on the VM.  As an example\: "Network Adapter 1" would have be deviceNumber "1".
Examples\: If a VM as a network adapter named "Network Adapter 1" the deviceNumber would be "1".
    netPortGroup - Name of port group to connect this NIC to.  This port group can be a legacy port group or a distributed virtual port group.
Examples\: "VM Network", "dvPortGroup"
    netNicType - Virtual network interface card type. NIC type VmxNet2 is only supported for virtual machine hardware version 4 and later.  NIC type VmxNet3 is only supported for vitual machine hardware version 7 and later.
Valid values\: "PCNet32", "E1000", "VmxNet", "VmxNet2", "VmxNet3"
    netMacAddr - MAC address to assign if netMacGeneration is set to Manual.
Value format\: Six groups of two hexadecimal digits (0-F), separated by colons (\:).
Examples\: 00\:50\:56\:94\:AB\:EF
    netMacGeneration - MAC address assignment method. 
Valid inputs\: "Manual", "Generated", "Assigned" (Assigned value is only valid when host is a vCenter server. Will assign MAC from vCenter).
    netWakeOnLan - Enable Wake On LAN for the NIC.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connect - Connect the NIC to the network?  Only applicable when VM is powered on.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connectAtPowerOn - Connect the NIC to the network at power on time of VM?
Valid values\: "true", "false"

Responses\:
    success - The operation completed successfully.
    failure - Something went wrong. See returnResult for details.

Returns\:
    returnResult - Task result or operation result

Notes\:
1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.92c1ac8d-8bfe-49e7-b240-6d833f8b74a8.description=
Add a Network Interface Card to a virtual machine assigned to a port group / network name.

Inputs\:
host - VMWare host hostname or IP.
user - VMWare username.
password - VMWare user's password.
port - Port to connect on.
protocol - Connection protocol (http or https).
closeSession - Close the internally kept VMWare Infrastructure API session at completion of operation (true, false).
async - Asynchronously perform the task (true, false).
taskTimeOut - Time to wait before the operation is considered to have failed (seconds)
virtualMachine - Primary Virtual Machine identifier. Inventorypath (Datacenter/vm/Folder/MyVM), Name of VM, IP (IPv4 or IPv6 depending upon ESX version), hostname (full), UUID, or the VM id (vm-123,123).
vmIdentifierType - Virtual machine identifier type (inventorypath, name, ip, hostname, uuid, vmid).
vmDatacenter - Virtual machine's datacenter.
netPortGroup - Name of port group to connect this new NIC to. This port group can be a legacy port group or a distributed virtual port group.
netNicType - Virtual network interface card type. Valid inputs\: PCNet32, E1000, VmxNet, VmxNet2, VmxNet3. NIC type VmxNet2 is only supported for virtual machine hardware version 4 and later.  NIC type VmxNet3 is only supported for vitual machine hardware version 7 and later.
netMacAddr - MAC address to assign if netMacGeneration is set to Manual.
netMacGeneration - MAC address assignment. Valid inputs\: Manual, Generated, Assigned (Assigned value is only valid when host is a vCenter server. Will assign MAC from vCenter).
netWakeOnLan - Enable Wake On LAN for the NIC (true, false).

Responses\:
success - The operation completed successfully.
failure - Something went wrong.

Returns\:
returnResult - Task result or operation result.

Notes\:
Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.949e04b6-8c66-46d3-a862-60f0ef5eec2b.prompt=VMWare Host\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.aad1b5dd-6d6e-4ba7-81a0-2963052a72f7.prompt=Network Name / Port Group\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.bb395831-76d3-4142-8583-51f695f6f2e7.prompt=Datacenter to look for VM\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.bc2f6c8d-9212-4020-9e0e-eeb60a639061.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.c010ed53-679d-4030-971b-2223a79e2345.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.c3587a79-2d74-4da0-adbe-e27f49d9c790.prompt=Password\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.c4245c68-5abb-43f1-986f-147721bb68ed.prompt=Virtual Machine\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.c936a2a8-3355-4c43-9e96-2c8637020d6c.prompt=Password\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.cb627125-85d5-41f0-b2a3-d47be22463e2.prompt=VMWare Host\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.d81e5ab5-a622-4ce3-9cfa-8e00b51f369c.prompt=VMWare Host\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.eed74078-36ec-40e7-9a45-86e0047b2ac6.prompt=VMWare User\: 48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.ef8d164b-1571-4f10-b0c7-601291df747a.description=

Inputs\:
    host - VMware vCenter, ESX or ESXi host hostname or IP.

    password - VMware user's password.
    port - Port to connect on.

    protocol - Connection protocol.

Valid values\: "true", "false"

    netPortGroup - Name of port group to connect this NIC to.  This port group can be a legacy port group or a distributed virtual port group.
Examples\: "VM Network", "dvPortGroup"
    netNicType - Virtual network interface card type. NIC type VmxNet2 is only supported for virtual machine hardware version 4 and later.  NIC type VmxNet3 is only supported for vitual machine hardware version 7 and later.
Valid values\: "PCNet32", "E1000", "VmxNet", "VmxNet2", "VmxNet3"
    netMacAddr - MAC address to assign if netMacGeneration is set to Manual.
Value format\: Six groups of two hexadecimal digits (0-F), separated by colons (\:).
Examples\: 00\:50\:56\:94\:AB\:EF
    netMacGeneration - MAC address assignment method. 
Valid inputs\: "Manual", "Generated", "Assigned" (Assigned value is only valid when host is a vCenter server. Will assign MAC from vCenter).
    netWakeOnLan - Enable Wake On LAN for the NIC.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connect - Connect the NIC to the network?  Only applicable when VM is powered on.
Valid values\: "true", "false"
    connectAtPowerOn - Connect the NIC to the network at power on time of VM?
Valid values\: "true", "false"

Responses\:

    failure - Something went wrong. See returnResult for details.

1. Inventory Path Formatting\: If host is an ESX server inventory path will be\: ha-datacenter/vm/ .  If host is a vCenter the inventory path will be\: /vm// . The / part of the path is based on the "Virtual Machines & Templates" view in the vCenter client. The inventory path is case sensitive.
48baee9f-9511-4ead-8503-2f90454b3be6.ef8eecf6-192d-48f9-ac10-85ad64d80b9e.prompt=MAC Address\:
flow.name: vCenter_setNetwork
